speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: SCENE III. An ante-chamber of the QUEEN'S apartments.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Enter ANNE and an Old Lady

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Not for that neither: here's the pang that pinches:

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: His highness having lived so long with her, and she

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: So good a lady that no tongue could ever

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Pronounce dishonour of her; by my life,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: She never knew harm-doing: O, now, after

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: So many courses of the sun enthroned,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Still growing in a majesty and pomp, the which

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: To leave a thousand-fold more bitter than

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: 'Tis sweet at first to acquire,--after this process,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: To give her the avaunt! it is a pity

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Would move a monster.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Hearts of most hard temper

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Melt and lament for her.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: O, God's will! much better

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: She ne'er had known pomp: though't be temporal,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Yet, if that quarrel, fortune, do divorce

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: It from the bearer, 'tis a sufferance panging

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: As soul and body's severing.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Alas, poor lady!

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: She's a stranger now again.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: So much the more

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Must pity drop upon her. Verily,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: I swear, 'tis better to be lowly born,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: And range with humble livers in content,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Than to be perk'd up in a glistering grief,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: And wear a golden sorrow.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Our content

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Is our best having.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: By my troth and maidenhead,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: I would not be a queen.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Beshrew me, I would,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: And venture maidenhead for't; and so would you,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: For all this spice of your hypocrisy:

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: You, that have so fair parts of woman on you,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Have too a woman's heart; which ever yet

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Affected eminence, wealth, sovereignty;

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Which, to say sooth, are blessings; and which gifts,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Saving your mincing, the capacity

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Of your soft cheveril conscience would receive,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: If you might please to stretch it.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Nay, good troth.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Yes, troth, and troth; you would not be a queen?

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: No, not for all the riches under heaven.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Old Lady: 'Tis strange: a three-pence bow'd would hire me,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Old as I am, to queen it: but, I pray you,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: What think you of a duchess? have you limbs

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: To bear that load of title?

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: No, in truth.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Then you are weakly made: pluck off a little;

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: I would not be a young count in your way,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: For more than blushing comes to: if your back

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Cannot vouchsafe this burthen,'tis too weak

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Ever to get a boy.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: How you do talk!

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: I swear again, I would not be a queen

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: For all the world.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: In faith, for little England

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: You'ld venture an emballing: I myself

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Would for Carnarvonshire, although there long'd

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: No more to the crown but that. Lo, who comes here?

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Enter Chamberlain

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Good morrow, ladies. What were't worth to know

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The secret of your conference?

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: My good lord,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Not your demand; it values not your asking:

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Our mistress' sorrows we were pitying.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: It was a gentle business, and becoming

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The action of good women: there is hope

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: All will be well.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Now, I pray God, amen!

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: You bear a gentle mind, and heavenly blessings

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Follow such creatures. That you may, fair lady,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Perceive I speak sincerely, and high note's

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Ta'en of your many virtues, the king's majesty

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Commends his good opinion of you, and

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Does purpose honour to you no less flowing

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Than Marchioness of Pembroke: to which title

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: A thousand pound a year, annual support,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Out of his grace he adds.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: I do not know

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: What kind of my obedience I should tender;

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: More than my all is nothing: nor my prayers

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Are not words duly hallow'd, nor my wishes

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: More worth than empty vanities; yet prayers and wishes

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Are all I can return. Beseech your lordship,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Vouchsafe to speak my thanks and my obedience,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: As from a blushing handmaid, to his highness;

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Whose health and royalty I pray for.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Lady,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: I shall not fail to approve the fair conceit

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: The king hath of you.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Aside

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: I have perused her well;

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Beauty and honour in her are so mingled

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: That they have caught the king: and who knows yet

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: But from this lady may proceed a gem

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: To lighten all this isle? I'll to the king,

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: And say I spoke with you.

speaker: Chamberlain
text_entry: Exit Chamberlain

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: My honour'd lord.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Why, this it is; see, see!

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: I have been begging sixteen years in court,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Am yet a courtier beggarly, nor could

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Come pat betwixt too early and too late

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: For any suit of pounds; and you, O fate!

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: A very fresh-fish here--fie, fie, fie upon

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: This compell'd fortune!--have your mouth fill'd up

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Before you open it.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: This is strange to me.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: How tastes it? is it bitter? forty pence, no.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: There was a lady once, 'tis an old story,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: That would not be a queen, that would she not,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: For all the mud in Egypt: have you heard it?

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Come, you are pleasant.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: With your theme, I could

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: O'ermount the lark. The Marchioness of Pembroke!

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: A thousand pounds a year for pure respect!

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: No other obligation! By my life,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: That promises moe thousands: honour's train

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Is longer than his foreskirt. By this time

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: I know your back will bear a duchess: say,

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Are you not stronger than you were?

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Good lady,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: Make yourself mirth with your particular fancy,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: And leave me out on't. Would I had no being,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: If this salute my blood a jot: it faints me,

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: To think what follows.

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: The queen is comfortless, and we forgetful

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: In our long absence: pray, do not deliver

speaker: ANNE
text_entry: What here you've heard to her.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: What do you think me?

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Exeunt
